  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager",
  "description": "Stivlon Consulting is your&nbsp;strategic partner in building high-performance teams and unlocking individual potential. We are passionate about finding the perfect fit&mdash;the talented individuals who elevate your company and the fulfilling career paths that ignite professional growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Work Mode: Hybrid (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)

About the Role


	We are seeking a highly creative, organised, and results-driven Social Media Manager for one of our clients in the event management and production sector to lead their social media strategy and execution for their growing event management and production brand.
	This role requires a content-savvy individual who understands how to create buzz, build community, and drive engagement across multiple social platforms.
	You will play a key role in shaping the brand&rsquo;s digital voice, promoting high-profile events, and enhancing visibility in Nigeria&rsquo;s vibrant event and experiential marketing industry.


Key Responsibilities
Content Strategy &amp; Execution:


	Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy aligned with marketing goals, event calendars, and brand messaging.
	Plan, create, and publish engaging content (images, videos, reels, behind-the-scenes, stories, captions, etc.) across Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, and YouTube.
	Ensure consistent brand tone, aesthetics, and messaging across platforms.


Campaign Management:


	Conceptualize and execute promotional campaigns for upcoming events, partnerships, and special projects.
	Collaborate with the Creative, Events, and PR teams to amplify key initiatives and sponsorship campaigns.


Audience Engagement &amp; Growth:


	Grow online community and engagement rates through organic and paid tactics.
	Monitor comments, DMs, mentions, and conversations to respond promptly and build strong relationships with followers and fans.
	Use social listening tools to understand audience preferences and sentiment.


Analytics &amp; Reporting:


	Track performance metrics, analyze trends, and generate weekly/monthly reports with actionable insights to optimize content and strategy.
	Stay ahead of platform algorithm changes and emerging trends to maintain and grow visibility.


Collaboration &amp; Content Coordination:


	Work closely with photographers, videographers, editors, and graphic designers to ensure high-quality, timely content production.
	Coordinate real-time event coverage including live tweets, stories, and post-event highlights.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Mass Communication, Marketing, Media Studies, or related discipline.
	4 - 5 years of proven experience managing social media for a lifestyle, events, production, or entertainment-related brand.
	Proficiency in social media scheduling tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Buffer, Later).
	Strong visual aesthetic and working knowledge of design/editing tools (e.g., Canva, CapCut, Adobe Creative Suite).
	Excellent copywriting skills with a creative, engaging voice.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends or late evenings during event coverage.
	Good understanding of Lagos&rsquo; social and cultural scene is a strong plus.


Desirable Attributes:


	Passion for events, entertainment, and creative storytelling.
	Strong multitasking and time management skills.
	Solution-oriented mindset and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong attention to detail and appreciation for high production value.


Salary
N250,000 &ndash; N300,000 monthly

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should their Resume to:&nbsp;stivlonjobs@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Work Mode: Hybrid (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)

	This role requires a content-savvy individual who understands how to create buzz, build community, and drive engagement across multiple social platforms.
	You will play a key role in shaping the brand’s digital voice, promoting high-profile events, and enhancing visibility in Nigeria’s vibrant event and experiential marketing industry.


Key Responsibilities
Content Strategy & Execution:


	Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy aligned with marketing goals, event calendars, and brand messaging.
	Plan, create, and publish engaging content (images, videos, reels, behind-the-scenes, stories, captions, etc.) across Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, and YouTube.
	Ensure consistent brand tone, aesthetics, and messaging across platforms.


Campaign Management:


	Conceptualize and execute promotional campaigns for upcoming events, partnerships, and special projects.
	Collaborate with the Creative, Events, and PR teams to amplify key initiatives and sponsorship campaigns.


Audience Engagement & Growth:


	Grow online community and engagement rates through organic and paid tactics.
	Monitor comments, DMs, mentions, and conversations to respond promptly and build strong relationships with followers and fans.
	Use social listening tools to understand audience preferences and sentiment.


Analytics & Reporting:


	Track performance metrics, analyze trends, and generate weekly/monthly reports with actionable insights to optimize content and strategy.
	Stay ahead of platform algorithm changes and emerging trends to maintain and grow visibility.


Collaboration & Content Coordination:


	Work closely with photographers, videographers, editors, and graphic designers to ensure high-quality, timely content production.
	Coordinate real-time event coverage including live tweets, stories, and post-event highlights.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mass Communication, Marketing, Media Studies, or related discipline.

	Proficiency in social media scheduling tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Buffer, Later).

N250,000 – N300,000 monthly
